consequences.description: Debris cuts hydraulic lines in the wing or fuselage.
Debris punctures wing fuel tanks, causing a leak or fire.
Shrapnel damages flaps or aileron actuators.
Loss of all glass cockpit displays. Standby instruments only.
Loss of boost pumps; engines rely on gravity feed or suction.
Reversion to Direct Law or Mechanical Backup.
Hypoxia risk. Mandatory oxygen mask usage. Cognitive load increases.
Pressure differential causes secondary structural damage (floor collapse).

complexity_levels.rookie: Isolated single-system failures (e.g., one radio fails).
complexity_levels.intermediate: Single critical system failure with clear checklist (e.g., Engine Fire).
complexity_levels.advanced: Interrelated system failures (e.g., Engine failure causing hydraulic loss).
complexity_levels.devil: Hidden or contradictory failures (e.g., Pitot blockage with false overspeed warnings and secondary electrical glitches).
